challenges.title: Fermentation Complexity
challenges.explanation: Bread fermentation is a highly complex biochemical process governed by numerous variables: temperature, humidity, yeast strain, flour composition (protein content, bran levels), and initial dough conditions.  Current automation struggles to accurately replicate these conditions and the resulting, unpredictable changes in gas production and flavor development. Precise control systems for recreating the ‘natural’ environment required for optimal yeast activity are extremely challenging to implement and maintain consistently.  Simulating the microbiome diversity and the nuanced interactions within the dough is currently beyond the capabilities of even sophisticated sensors and control algorithms.
